turns.speaker: SUE
turns.text: But <u>we're</u> the focus, right Reed? <u>Reed</u>...?

turns.speaker: REED
turns.text: Of course.  Of course.

turns.speaker: SUE
turns.text: And you sure you can control this thing?  Last time didn't work out so well.

turns.speaker: REED
turns.text: With the right energy, we can stabilize the storm.  Maybe tie into the city grid...

turns.speaker: SUE
turns.text: Reed.  How close are we to a cure?

turns.speaker: REED
turns.text: No way to know.  Without more tests, experiments.

turns.speaker: SUE
turns.text: Don't let Victor push you into making a mistake --

turns.speaker: REED
turns.text: He was going to take away all my data, equipment --

turns.speaker: SUE
turns.text: Better than your <u>life</u>.  Victor's not the one who has to get into that thing.  <u>We</u> are.

turns.speaker: REED
turns.text: Which is why I'm working <u>twenty</u> hours a day, checking every variable --

turns.speaker: SUE
turns.text: Every variable but <u>yourself</u>.  You don't eat, sleep.  You can't live in your head like --

turns.speaker: REED
turns.text: <u>I'm</u> not the only one in there.  I got you, Vic, Ben, Johnny, all rattling around in there.

turns.speaker: REED
turns.text: I could get Ben to tap into the Baxter's main power to generate enough voltage --

turns.speaker: SUE
turns.text: Reed.  Shh.  Just be quiet.  And look up.

turns.speaker: SUE
turns.text: Remember our first date here...?  God, I was so nervous.

turns.speaker: REED
turns.text: You <u>were</u>?

turns.speaker: SUE
turns.text: Of course I was.  I'd read all your papers on bioethics.  Some of them two times just so I'd have something to say to you.

turns.speaker: REED
turns.text: You know, I bribed the projectionist ten bucks to keep it open late?

turns.speaker: SUE
turns.text: I gave him twenty.

turns.speaker: REED
turns.text: You always talked about how you liked the kind of man who could approach you...speak his mind.  One who wasn't afraid to tell you what he wanted.

turns.speaker: SUE
turns.text: I did.  I did, Reed...but I wanted <u>you</u> to be that man.

turns.speaker: SUE
turns.text: When I walked out, I waited <u>ten</u> <u>minutes</u> outside your door.  Ten. Waiting for you to come find me.

turns.speaker: REED
turns.text: Why didn't you say something?

turns.speaker: SUE
turns.text: That would have kinda defeated the purpose.  And Reed...  I'm saying it now.

turns.speaker: REED
turns.text: I can...make it work.

turns.speaker: SUE
turns.text: Reed, stop, you need to rest your --

turns.speaker: REED
turns.text: The power...I need...more power...to control...the storm --

turns.speaker: SUE
turns.text: You <u>need</u> a doctor.

turns.speaker: REED
turns.text: Sue, I need some of that anger, rage, frustration --

turns.speaker: SUE
turns.text: I'm sure I can come up with something.

turns.speaker: REED
turns.text: I found a broken gasket, from space --

turns.speaker: SUE
turns.text: A <u>gasket</u>?  Reed, we're at a party.

turns.speaker: SUE
turns.text: It's just business.

turns.speaker: VICTOR
turns.text: I think you both know my Director of Genetic Research, Susan Storm.

turns.speaker: VICTOR
turns.text: Surprised I agreed to Reed's proposal?

turns.speaker: SUE
turns.text: I understand the business reasons.

turns.speaker: VICTOR
turns.text: Well, when you're looking at your future, it never hurts to find closure about the past.

turns.speaker: SUE
turns.text: It's been a good two years, Victor... The company's accomplished so much.

turns.speaker: VICTOR
turns.text: Right, of course, the company... But you see, I've come to realize all the accomplishments in the world mean nothing without someone to share them with --

turns.speaker: SUE
turns.text: Uh, Victor, I hope I haven't done something to make you think...

turns.speaker: VICTOR
turns.text: Sue, I've lived my life unafraid of taking big steps.  And this is the biggest step yet.  If it helps, think of this as a <u>promotion</u>.  A merger of sorts...  Four little words that can change our lives...

turns.speaker: SUE
turns.text: What are you doing?

turns.speaker: VICTOR
turns.text: Raising the shields.

turns.speaker: SUE
turns.text: You can't leave them out there.

turns.speaker: VICTOR
turns.text: What's going on?

turns.speaker: SUE
turns.text: Victor, are you feeling alright?

turns.speaker: SUE
turns.text: Victor, I'm sorry I --

turns.speaker: VICTOR
turns.text: Just <u>find</u> him.

turns.speaker: SUE
turns.text: Victor, your scar --

turns.speaker: VICTOR
turns.text: I told you, I'm fine.  It's <u>you</u> I'm worried about.

turns.speaker: SUE
turns.text: I'm sorry I didn't get a chance to --

turns.speaker: VICTOR
turns.text: Please, no apologies.  I've arranged for your things to be moved to one of my condos.  You'll have round-the clock care.

turns.speaker: SUE
turns.text: You said it was urgent.

turns.speaker: VICTOR
turns.text: It is.  There's something we need to talk about.  Something I need to ask you...

turns.speaker: SUE
turns.text: Victor, wait, slow down a second.  I want you to know I appreciate everything you've done for me, but I just don't --

turns.speaker: VICTOR
turns.text: Susan.  What are you doing?

turns.speaker: SUE
turns.text: He's working round the clock.  But the data needs to be tested, analyzed before --

turns.speaker: VICTOR
turns.text: Same old Reed.  All analysis, no action.  Wasn't that the problem with you two?

turns.speaker: SUE
turns.text: If these molecules aren't stable, they could make us <u>worse</u>, maybe even kill us.

turns.speaker: VICTOR
turns.text: Then why is Reed dragging his feet? Maybe he <u>likes</u> having his prize specimen under glass...  It's ironic, isn't it?  You're finally the perfect woman for him...because you're his <u>science project</u>.

turns.speaker: SUE
turns.text: Please don't make this personal --

turns.speaker: VICTOR
turns.text: Oh, I think you already have.

turns.speaker: SUE
turns.text: Victor, we <u>can't do anything</u> until the research is ready.

turns.speaker: THE THING
turns.text: 'Scuse me.

turns.speaker: VICTOR
turns.text: I know it can't be easy.  Life hasn't changed that much for Reed, Sue and Johnny.  At least they can go out in public.  But for you?  People staring. Whispering behind your back...

turns.speaker: THE THING
turns.text: If you're trying to cheer me up you're doing a helluva job --

turns.speaker: VICTOR
turns.text: I'm just saying, I know what it's like to lose something you love.  To see it slip away, and know it's never coming back.

turns.speaker: THE THING
turns.text: Reed's gonna fix me up --

turns.speaker: VICTOR
turns.text: For your sake I hope you're right. I'm sorry if that sounds a little skeptical.

turns.speaker: THE THING
turns.text: Skeptical...?

turns.speaker: CARTER
turns.text: Grant's uniquely qualified for this mission. He's a Communications Expert and was a Frogman during the War. Besides, he brought Benes into this country, and the fewer people who know about him, the better. At any rate, you'll find Grant invaluable, should anything go wrong once you're under way.  Okay, Don.

turns.speaker: REID
turns.text: Here's the overall Target Area...

turns.speaker: REID
turns.text: Benes' natural defenses. White Corpuscles -- Antibodies. Once you begin to grow -- and become a menace to the body -- you'll trigger them off... MICHAELS With all the unknown factors in the body, I still say risking five lives for one is something we should reconsider --

turns.speaker: CARTER
turns.text: We understand your concern, but we've made our decision, Doctor. Any questions? Anybody?

turns.speaker: CARTER
turns.text: Where do we stand?

turns.speaker: REID
turns.text: Medical's ready.

turns.speaker: REID
turns.text: Okay to proceed.

turns.speaker: CARTER
turns.text: Phase Two.

turns.speaker: REID
turns.text: They've crossed over into the Jugular Vein!

turns.speaker: CARTER
turns.text: That can't be -- there's no direct connection between the two --

turns.speaker: REID
turns.text: Normally not. Unless it's an Arterio-Venous Fistula --

turns.speaker: REID
turns.text: But we have no choice! We've got, to take them out!

turns.speaker: CARTER
turns.text: No...

turns.speaker: CARTER
turns.text: We still have fifty-one minutes. Leave them in.

turns.speaker: REID
turns.text: But it's hopeless! They can't go back and they can't go on. I tell you there's nothing else we can do but remove them!

turns.speaker: CARTER
turns.text: Not until the very last second. We must think of something... Something to save the situation.

turns.speaker: CARTER
turns.text: Doctor...without killing him -- how long could we stop his heart?

turns.speaker: REID
turns.text: The less time, the better.

turns.speaker: CARTER
turns.text: I know that. But what's the maximum?

turns.speaker: REID
turns.text: In his comatose state...and everything slowed down...no more than sixty seconds.

turns.speaker: CARTER
turns.text: At topspeed...and adjusting distance for Degree of Miniaturization --  The sub should get through the Heart in fifty-seven seconds.

turns.speaker: REID
turns.text: That would give us only three seconds to revive him...

turns.speaker: CARTER
turns.text: What are the problems in stopping the Heart?

turns.speaker: REID
turns.text: Nothing -- compared to starting it up again.

turns.speaker: REID
turns.text: <Cardiac Red Alert> we're stopping the Heart.

turns.speaker: CARTER
turns.text: Message to Proteus.

turns.speaker: CARTER
turns.text: They're in the Pulmonary Artery.

turns.speaker: REID
turns.text: They'll make up some time, once they get through that and reach the Pleural Cavity.  Respiration Post...

turns.speaker: CARTER
turns.text: Another delay... With only forty-two minutes left.

turns.speaker: REID
turns.text: It'll be close -- but there's still a margin of safety.

turns.speaker: CARTER
turns.text: Let's find what the devil's holding them up!  Contact the Proteus!

turns.speaker: REID
turns.text: I told you to cut down on the sugar.

turns.speaker: CARTER
turns.text: I can't help it. I'm just weak, I guess.

turns.speaker: REID
turns.text: Time's up... We'll have to take them out immediately.

turns.speaker: CARTER
turns.text: It means killing Benes...  And for all we know, they may have completed the operation!  Damn it to hell!

turns.speaker: REID
turns.text: What is it?

turns.speaker: CARTER
turns.text: That blip we're picking up might only be the radio-active particle. The Proteus may already be destroyed...

turns.speaker: REID
turns.text: What're you getting at?

turns.speaker: CARTER
turns.text: If I were in their place and I'd run out of time, I'd abandon the ship before I grew to dangerous size... and use the few extra minutes to get out the quickest way possible, on my own...

turns.speaker: REID
turns.text: Along the Optic Nerve to the Eye.

turns.speaker: CARTER
turns.text: Now how soon can we try Sodium Pentathol?

turns.speaker: REID
turns.text: I'd hold that off awhile.

turns.speaker: CARTER
turns.text: Well, how about hypnosis? That can't hurt him!

turns.speaker: CARTER
turns.text: Hello, Grant. Good to see you again.

turns.speaker: GRANT
turns.text: The Pentagon, wasn't it, General? Only you weren't in that uniform...

turns.speaker: GRANT
turns.text: Benes... What the devil happened?

turns.speaker: CARTER
turns.text: The Other Side got to him.

turns.speaker: GRANT
turns.text: How bad off is he?

turns.speaker: CARTER
turns.text: Brain injury.

turns.speaker: GRANT
turns.text: Before or after what he wanted to tell you?

turns.speaker: CARTER
turns.text: Before he could breathe a word. He's the only scientist who knows the answer to what we're after. That's why we have to operate --

turns.speaker: CARTER
turns.text: -- and why we need you.

turns.speaker: GRANT
turns.text: <Me>?

turns.speaker: GRANT
turns.text: I can't even put a Band-Aid on my finger.

turns.speaker: CARTER
turns.text: Here's the Surgeon.

turns.speaker: CARTER
turns.text: Duval. Dr. Peter Duval. Top brain man in the country. Ever hear of him?

turns.speaker: GRANT
turns.text: Sorry, but I'm rusty on surgeons. Who's the girl?

turns.speaker: CARTER
turns.text: Cora Peterson, his Technical Assistant. You'll join Duval and the others --

turns.speaker: GRANT
turns.text: What can I do? Except maybe pass out?

turns.speaker: GRANT
turns.text: Wish I knew why.

turns.speaker: CARTER
turns.text: Tell him where he fits in, will you? I've got a few things to check out.

turns.speaker: GRANT
turns.text: But why take the chance, when there must be other doctors?

turns.speaker: CARTER
turns.text: We have no choice. Duval's the most skillful brain surgeon in the country, and he's right here, at hand.

turns.speaker: GRANT
turns.text: I wouldn't know if he's trying to save him or kill him.

turns.speaker: GRANT
turns.text: Right, sir.

turns.speaker: CARTER
turns.text: Come along, they'll be operating shortly.  See you later, Mike.

turns.speaker: GRANT
turns.text: His technician okay? In addition to the Looks Department?

turns.speaker: CARTER
turns.text: No question of her loyalty.

turns.speaker: GRANT
turns.text: I don't mean to be inquisitive. But this <CMDF> -- for all I know it could stand for <Consolidated Mobilization of Female Delinquents>?

turns.speaker: CARTER
turns.text: <Combined Miniature Deterrent Forces>.

turns.speaker: GRANT
turns.text: Say that again?

turns.speaker: GRANT
turns.text: General, I've heard some wild ones. But this takes it.

turns.speaker: CARTER
turns.text: We can shrink an Army -- with all its equipment -- and put it in a bottle cap. That's why we call it <Combined Miniature Deterrent Forces>.

turns.speaker: GRANT
turns.text: If the Other Side ever gets hold of a thing like that...

turns.speaker: CARTER
turns.text: They have...  But we've both got the same problem -- lack or control. We can only keep things Miniaturized for exactly sixty minutes. Arter that, everything starts growing back to its original size.

turns.speaker: GRANT
turns.text: I assume Benes knows how to control it.

turns.speaker: CARTER
turns.text: That's right. He wanted us to have the secret, and not them. Which is why they tried to kill him.

turns.speaker: GRANT
turns.text: They're bound to try again. No wonder they want me to stand by during the operation.

turns.speaker: CARTER
turns.text: And take a little trip with them...

turns.speaker: GRANT
turns.text: Trip? Where to?

turns.speaker: CARTER
turns.text: Well, the only way to reach that clot is from inside the Brain. So we've decided to put a Surgical Team and a Crew into a submarine -- reduce it way down in size, and inject it into an Artery --

turns.speaker: GRANT
turns.text: You mean <I'm> going along?

turns.speaker: CARTER
turns.text: As part of the Crew.

turns.speaker: GRANT
turns.text: Wait a minute! They can't shrink <me>!

turns.speaker: CARTER
turns.text: Grant, our Miniaturizer can shrink anything.

turns.speaker: GRANT
turns.text: But I don't want to be Miniaturized -- !

turns.speaker: CARTER
turns.text: It's only for an hour --

turns.speaker: GRANT
turns.text: Not even for a minute! General Carter, sir, I'd like you to reconsider your choice. I'm just not the right man for a mission of this kind.

turns.speaker: CARTER
turns.text: This is Dr. Duval, our Head Surgeon.

turns.speaker: GRANT
turns.text: Oh yes, I've heard of you, Doctor.

turns.speaker: CARTER
turns.text: There'll be a team of Surgeons standing by. We're prepared to remove you immediately, should anything go wrong. In any event, you must be out within sixty minutes. After that, you'll be in danger of attack.

turns.speaker: GRANT
turns.text: Attack? Who -- or should I say what from?

turns.speaker: GRANT
turns.text: Just one, General...

turns.speaker: CARTER
turns.text: Yes?

turns.speaker: GRANT
turns.text: Where can I get a cab back to town?

turns.speaker: CARTER
turns.text: Oh yes, great. The only problem is, he can't remember what he came to tell us.

turns.speaker: GRANT
turns.text: Can't remember?... What do you mean?

turns.speaker: CARTER
turns.text: He's blanked out on that one particular point.

turns.speaker: GRANT
turns.text: Yes, we'd like to get moving.

turns.speaker: CARTER
turns.text: Why don't you go on. We'll meet you at the Clearance Desk in a few minutes.

turns.speaker: MICHAELS
turns.text: Yes, Alan.

turns.speaker: CARTER
turns.text: Meet Grant. This is Dr. Michaels, Chief of the Medical Section.

turns.speaker: MICHAELS
turns.text: Glad to have you with us, Mr. Grant.

turns.speaker: CARTER
turns.text: [LINE OF DIALOGUE CUT OFF]

turns.speaker: MICHAELS
turns.text: I don't agree. Just because he's often difficult --

turns.speaker: CARTER
turns.text: Difficult? He's impossible!

turns.speaker: MICHAELS
turns.text: That's no reason to suspect him of disloyalty.

turns.speaker: MICHAELS
turns.text: I'll be standing by. <I'll> know.

turns.speaker: CARTER
turns.text: And no matter what happens, you're to take orders <only> from Dr. Michaels, understand?

turns.speaker: CORA
turns.text: Listen...the Heart.

turns.speaker: MICHAELS
turns.text: Yes...slowed down agreat deal.

turns.speaker: CORA
turns.text: I can't imagine how it possibly could have come loose. I distinctly recall fastening it with all four bolts --

turns.speaker: MICHAELS
turns.text: It must have been jarred loose during the whirlpool.

turns.speaker: CORA
turns.text: But we just can't leave him in there! What'll happen to him?

turns.speaker: MICHAELS
turns.text: We'll know -- in the next breath...

turns.speaker: MICHAELS
turns.text: That's beside the point now.  I don't see the sense of going on.

turns.speaker: CORA
turns.text: We must!

turns.speaker: MICHAELS
turns.text: With no laser --

turns.speaker: CORA
turns.text: You're going out there? With those Antibodies --

turns.speaker: MICHAELS
turns.text: No danger of attack, as long as you don't trigger them off by any injury to the System.

turns.speaker: CORA
turns.text: Wouldn't it be quicker if we all helped?

turns.speaker: MICHAELS
turns.text: Yes, there's no time to spare. And those fibers can be quite tenacious.

turns.speaker: CORA
turns.text: Doctor...

turns.speaker: DUVAL
turns.text: Yes, Cora.

turns.speaker: CORA
turns.text: I -- I want to say...

turns.speaker: DUVAL
turns.text: What is it?  Anything wrong?

turns.speaker: CORA
turns.text: I just wanted to thank you for taking me along.

turns.speaker: DUVAL
turns.text: Thank you for volunteering.

turns.speaker: DUVAL
turns.text: Never saw <that>. Not even under an electron-mrcroscope.

turns.speaker: CORA
turns.text: They're much smaller than bacteria...

turns.speaker: DUVAL
turns.text: Yes, a fistula too small to show up on the X-rays.

turns.speaker: CORA
turns.text: But big enough for us...

turns.speaker: CORA
turns.text: Doctor...you can't mean that! Not when we've come this far. And if we give up, there'll be no way of saving Mr. Benes --

turns.speaker: DUVAL
turns.text: Dr. Michaels is right. We have no choice.

turns.speaker: CORA
turns.text: Air bubbles!... Doctor --

turns.speaker: DUVAL
turns.text: No danger of an embolism. At our reduced scale, they're much too minute to prove fatal to Benes.

turns.speaker: DUVAL
turns.text: Cora, is something wrong with the laser?

turns.speaker: CORA
turns.text: I don't know yet, Doctor. And I won't know until I test it.

turns.speaker: DUVAL
turns.text: He's making a fine recovery.

turns.speaker: CORA
turns.text: He certainly is. He should be up and about in no time.

turns.speaker: GRANT
turns.text: Bet you're pretty handy around the house... Can you cook?

turns.speaker: CORA
turns.text: We're pushing oxygen today.

turns.speaker: GRANT
turns.text: I'll take some Laughing Gas, ma'am.

turns.speaker: CORA
turns.text: You sound as if you're not looking forward to it.

turns.speaker: GRANT
turns.text: Well, it's not exactly a pleasure cruise.

turns.speaker: CORA
turns.text: I think it's the most exciting --  We're going to see things no one ever saw before. The actual physical process of Life itself -- not something under a microscope... Just think of it --

turns.speaker: GRANT
turns.text: That's the trouble. I am. Being shrunk...

turns.speaker: CORA
turns.text: You may learn to like it.

turns.speaker: CORA
turns.text: That'll teach you where to keep your hand.

turns.speaker: GRANT
turns.text: Now I know...

turns.speaker: GRANT
turns.text: That could be quite a lethal weapon... It could kill, not cure.

turns.speaker: CORA
turns.text: Not in the hands of a great surgeon like Dr. Duval. The beam of this laser can be regulated to one millionth of a millimeter.

turns.speaker: GRANT
turns.text: I understand you've been Dr. Duval's Assistant for quite some time... He must've snatched you out of the cradle.

turns.speaker: CORA
turns.text: I've been with him since I got out of school. He brought me into the CMDF, over five years ago.

turns.speaker: GRANT
turns.text: A long time, with one man.

turns.speaker: CORA
turns.text: Not working for someone like Dr. Duval --

turns.speaker: CORA
turns.text: I never...never imagined it could be anything...like this.

turns.speaker: GRANT
turns.text: I always thought it was nothing but red.

turns.speaker: GRANT
turns.text: -- at which point the Heart will be stopped by electric shock.

turns.speaker: CORA
turns.text: And if it should take more time to get through --

turns.speaker: GRANT
turns.text: Look at that...they're changing color...

turns.speaker: CORA
turns.text: Doctor -- is it possible? That we're seeing it happen before our eyes?

turns.speaker: GRANT
turns.text: Looks like you didn't batten it down too well.

turns.speaker: CORA
turns.text: But I did. I'm positive!

turns.speaker: GRANT
turns.text: Then how come it worked loose?

turns.speaker: CORA
turns.text: I have no idea.

turns.speaker: CORA
turns.text: Shouldn't you answer that?

turns.speaker: GRANT
turns.text: Not now. We need air, not greetings!

turns.speaker: GRANT
turns.text: I'll try to hold it from the other side of the wall, while you push from out here. Maybe that'll do it.

turns.speaker: CORA
turns.text: You can't --it's too dangerous --

turns.speaker: GRANT
turns.text: You must carry spare parts --

turns.speaker: CORA
turns.text: Not anything built into the chassis.  If it hadn't come loose --

turns.speaker: GRANT
turns.text: If you had a transistor about this size and power output, and a thin enough wire --  -- could you piece it together?

turns.speaker: CORA
turns.text: No, it requires such absolute precision --

turns.speaker: GRANT
turns.text: A surgeon might...

turns.speaker: CORA
turns.text: Oh yes, I'm sure Dr. Duval could. If we had the parts.

turns.speaker: GRANT
turns.text: I've got a source. All I have to do is tap it.

turns.speaker: CORA
turns.text: Open it! Open it before they get here!

turns.speaker: GRANT
turns.text: I can't till the hatch is flooded!

turns.speaker: GRANT
turns.text: No need to get up --

turns.speaker: CORA
turns.text: I feel much better now...

turns.speaker: CORA
turns.text: Thank you for saving my life.

turns.speaker: GRANT
turns.text: That's what they pay me for.

turns.speaker: CORA
turns.text: A great deal more than that, I believe...

turns.speaker: GRANT
turns.text: Such as?

turns.speaker: CORA
turns.text: Keeping an eye on Dr. Duval...

turns.speaker: GRANT
turns.text: What gives you that idea?

turns.speaker: CORA
turns.text: That's why you're really here. I knew it from the start.

turns.speaker: GRANT
turns.text: As obvious as that? Our Security people will jump for joy.  I suppose Duval's onto me, too?

turns.speaker: CORA
turns.text: You're not the first, but he's much too innocent, much too involved with his work, to realize what's going on around him.

turns.speaker: GRANT
turns.text: Under a cloud without cause, I take it.

turns.speaker: CORA
turns.text: Oh, no. Plenty of cause. He won't follow the herd, or change his convictions -- even when they're not popular. And he believes in an absolutely free interchange of information between scientists of different countries -- and these days, there's nothing more suspicious than that.

turns.speaker: GRANT
turns.text: Depends on which end of the telescope you look through.

turns.speaker: CORA
turns.text: What do you mean?

turns.speaker: GRANT
turns.text: Well, if you happen to be very fond of him -- even in love with him -- it would certainly affect your point of view.

turns.speaker: GRANT
turns.text: We better get back to the sub. Every second counts now.

turns.speaker: CORA
turns.text: Look! They follow the direction of her glance, are startled to see:

turns.speaker: DUVAL
turns.text: Doctor, what's wrong?

turns.speaker: MICHAELS
turns.text: I can't breathe!... I've got to get out!

turns.speaker: DUVAL
turns.text: It's too late now. We must go on.

turns.speaker: MICHAELS
turns.text: Looks like the molecular structure of proteins.

turns.speaker: DUVAL
turns.text: I don't agree. I think we ought to stop and take a sample.

turns.speaker: MICHAELS
turns.text: That's not the purpose of this mission.  Captain -- keep a straight course -- until you're in the clear.

turns.speaker: DUVAL
turns.text: But that isn't possible.

turns.speaker: MICHAELS
turns.text: Not in a sealed vessel like an Artery.  Captain -- something must be wrong with your controls!

turns.speaker: DUVAL
turns.text: We can't take a second more.

turns.speaker: MICHAELS
turns.text: Captain -- head in the d1rection of the flow and drift with it.

turns.speaker: MICHAELS
turns.text: Nothing miraculous about it. Just an interchange of gases. The end product of five hundred million years of Evolution.

turns.speaker: DUVAL
turns.text: You can't believe all that's accidental? That there isn't a Creative Intelligence at work --

turns.speaker: DUVAL
turns.text: What can we do?

turns.speaker: MICHAELS
turns.text: Nothing -- against all that force.
